oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lymus Wallace
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: government; portraits; Wallace, Lymus;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lymus Wallace, who was a city alderman, was one of the first black men to serve on the legislative council in Memphis city government. His term of office was in the 1880s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Memphis & Shelby County Room Photograph Collection
